pluggable.name: Options Manager
pluggable.author: Philip Olson
pluggable.description: Manages and exposes all Habari options within the habari options table. Note: This is powerful, with no undelete, so be careful!

help.value:
All options are exposed via this administration plugin. Edit wisely.

Choose view options to view all options, with the ability to edit or add additional ones. Configure has a couple of safe guard options, which by default disables delete/remove of both core and other options. Editing is always allowed, except renaming an option name qualifies as deleting the old one, so appropriate delete permissions are required for that.

You will have the power to damage your Habari setup, so, you have been warned.

help.name: Configure
help.value:
Remember: These configure options are mainly here to help decrease (or increase) the chances of you messing something up (e.g., accidentally delete a core option) but they aren't 100% intelligent. In other words, this plugin makes guesses regarding the option type (e.g., core, plugin, theme) and whether or not it's active. Unfortunately [currently] Habari allows plugins to pollute the Options namespace, so it's difficult to determine status with 100% accuracy.

You can always edit options, even when none of the delete checkboxes are checked.
